style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
West of the Rockies there is an ancient volcano known as the Grand Mesa, the largest geographic feature in the world of its kind. From this mountain runs a creek called Kannah that flows into the high desert of the Grand Valley of Colorado and offers some of the purest water in the United States.  At the foot of the Mesa, we stand, Kannah Creek Brewing Company, where we turn this pure, untouched snowmelt into award winning classic American craft ale.

Since 2005 Kannah Creek has been turning the finest ingredients and a privileged water source into amazing craft ale with a focus on quality and tradition.  With several awards to our name and a town full of friends we found demand soaring, and our 7 barrel system couldn't keep up. We have expanded into a 12,000 sq. ft., state of the art 30 barrel production facility, Edgewater, in South Downtown, Grand Junction, Colorado.

breweries.name: Parish Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Parish Brewing Co. is a nanobrewery (yes, nano! smaller than micro!) in Lafayette, Louisiana.  We supply Louisiana with uncompromising, craft brewed beer (or biere in our native cajun french).  Using only the finest ingredients, we'd never cut costs at the expense of flavor. 

Think of Parish as an upstart local brewery in cajun country doing battle against boring, tasteless swill.

Who knew that years later, their love of beer would bring them together.

data.name: Blackbird
data.description: A very flavorful creamy American Style stout.  This dark stout has generous amounts of roasted malts including chocolate, crystal and black (nine different grains added at different times during the mash process). Some flaked and roasted barley give it a dry finish with a nice foamy head (oh and a wee bit of wheat). Northern brewer and Willamette hops are in a supporting role, as they should be.  The results are an ale  that is slightly sweet but complex with flavors such as chocolate and coffees notes, accentuated with roasted dryness in the finish. An outstanding creamy stout that is complex and refreshing!

Derived from the Native American meaning of Omaha,  “upstream” or “against the current”, the Upstream Brewing  Company is just that—a restaurant different from the rest.

Since opening in 1996, the Upstream has been all about fresh—from the handcrafted beers to the locally grown produce to the lively atmosphere. Not to mention the friendly, knowledgeable staff. So stop in today, and find out why we’ve been named one of Omaha’s “Best” several years running.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

breweries.name: Hideout Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Originally opened in early 2005, the company was named for both the location and for the feel of pre-prohibition era local brewery. Taken over in early 2012 by new owners Scott Colson and Nick and Theresa Humphrey, the Hideout’s footprint has grown quite extensively. Now distributing to much of the southern half of the Lower Peninsula, they are adding new regions regularly. Coming soon will be bottled beer!

In the taproom, the selection recently increased to 25 taps directly behind the J shaped bar. The upper loft has darts, shuffle board and three big screen TVs. Behind the building you will find a Beer Garden including horseshoe pits and ample seating.

Menu beers available year round are Promiscuous Pilsner, Tommy Gun Red, Gangster IPA, and Smuggler’s Hazelnut Stout. Other offerings vary throughout the year including Wine, Seasonal and Specialty Beers, Hard Cider, and Mead.

data.name: Bone Crusher Stout
data.description: A robustly presented aggressive ale, built with 5 specialty malts and justly hopped to build a huge American stout, featuring smooth roasted-chocolate flavor and a big black malt finish. Two different hops secretively give a contrasting balance to the structured malts.

breweries.name: Schmohz Brewing Company
breweries.description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

breweries.name: Triton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana. 

Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.

Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.

Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.

data.name: Bourbon Barrel Stout
data.description: Goodwood Bourbon Barrel Stout is an homage to Kentucky’s proud distilling legacy – brewed with the same limestone water as its namesake whiskey and patiently seasoned in bourbon barrels. This silky American stout has notes of oak, dark roasted malts and, of course, bourbon. Roasted barley produces chocolate and coffee flavors with a lasting vanilla finish.

breweries.name: Goodwood Brewing
breweries.description:
The gents behind Goodwood are 3 of Louisville’s longest-serving brewing veterans, running production breweries here since 2001. Now thrilled to branch off on their own, this splinter group of beer makers has rebooted their brewery around the success of its renowned product: BBC Bourbon Barrel Stout, (now Goodwood Bourbon Barrel Stout.) To that end, Goodwood’s "shade-grown beers" are all touched by the natural gradations of reclaimed casks and other wood-types for flavorful expressions that are unique to the Goodwood.

Get lost in the wood.
Why take the extra time to wood-age beer? Why insist on the same pure, limestone water used to make bourbon? Well here at Goodwood, we've come to believe that what's good for the bourbon is even better for beer. Our extra steps are kind of an homage to this region's distilling legacy and to those old barrels out there that still have so much flavor left to give. sip one of our freshly nuanced stouts, lagers, or ales, and we believe you'll think so , too.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Levante Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Levante started as many home brewing dreams start; the mission to create the perfect beer in a three gallon pot in the kitchen of a small apartment. Eric and Tim quickly realized that this is an excercise in futility, but along the way, their steadfast persistence and the quest to make a truly satisfying beer has resulted in countless hours of research and experimentation. While the small 5 gallon batches allowed for plenty of great experience, they yearned for more creative control.

The brewers decided it was time for a more professional three vessel system, giving them complete control over the brewing process. The 1/2 barrel system gave the brewers a solid platform to refine and perfect a lineup of beers for the most discerning pallet. This led to the creation of several great recipes, and a roster of clean crisp beers. The original hobby transformed into a passion for sharing world-class hand crafted beers with those who would appreciate them. 

Levante Brewing currently brews on our 15 bbl production brewery system located in West Chester, PA. We are servicing several local restaurants, pubs and distributers. Levante aims to deliver a variety of creative brews to beer lovers in Philadelphia's western suburbs and beyond.

data.name: Bourbon Choc Stout
data.description: Just back from the 2011 KLCC Brewfest, garnering 2nd in the People's Choice Award we bring you something decadent. Like bourbon? Like chocolate? Like smooth dark beers? Cool because this chocolate stout delivers. We only have 5 kegs of this gem left so don't put this one off. Get down here!

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

data.name: Bourbon's Barrel Stout

breweries.name: Great Crescent Brewery
breweries.description:
The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities.
We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase.

We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

data.name: Braveheart Stout
data.description: Ray himself is not much of a Stout fan, so as a homebrewer, he created a Stout that he himself could enjoy. It's a simple recipe: no coffee, no chocolate, liquorice, anise or other ingredients that would conflict with German purity laws: Roasted Barley and Black Patent malt flavor this beer and make it one that Stout lovers and non-Stout lovers alike can enjoy. Try it! It's AWESOME!

breweries.name: Soo Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
It is the mission of Soo Brewing Company to produce beer that the people of Sault Ste. Marie can be proud of – beer that meets and exceeds the highest standard, our own. Our products will be unique and innovative, yet hold true to the old-world brewing traditions of our ancestors. The product will be affordable, allowing everyday people the opportunity to enjoy great hand-crafted beer.

The profits made by Soo Brewing Company will be put back into the community whenever possible. Employees of Soo Brewing Company will be treated like family, paid a livable wage and given the opportunity to advance through hard work. All employees will be fully knowledgeable about the product, the process and culture of beer and will treat customers as they would guests in their own home.

Soo Brewing Company will strive to promote beer culture and responsible enjoyment of the product, and will be relentless in our effort to improve the quality of the product and the efficiency by which it is produced. Soo Brewing Company will be a shining example of corporate ethics and social responsibility, and above all, enjoy what we do every day.

breweries.name: Arbor Ales
breweries.description:
We've been brewing our beers in the fine city of Bristol since 2007. All of our beers are brewed with the intention of creating something we'll enjoy drinking ourselves and, more importantly, something we're proud to put our name to. In a world of endless possibilities, we try to explore as many of them as possible, which is why to date we've brewed in excess of two hundred different beers: some of them regulars, the odd few occasionals, and far too many one-offs to remember let alone try to name!
You should be able to find our beers on offer nationwide in the kind of pubs and bars that have the freedom and willingness to stock good beer. While most of it goes into cask, you'll also find it in keg or bottle if you look in the right places.

breweries.name: Jailhouse Brewing Company
breweries.description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.

data.name: Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout
data.description: This is the famous Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout, our award-winning rendition of the Imperial Stout style, once made exclusively for Catherine the Great. We use three mashes to brew each batch of this beer, achieving a luscious deep dark chocolate flavor through a blend of specially roasted malts. We brew it every year for the winter season. It is delicious when newly bottled, but also ages beautifully for years.
data.foodPairings: Served in a snifter glass, Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout is excellent with chocolate desserts, cheesecake, fruit tarts, and ice cream. It is also a very good accompaniment to strong cheeses, such as Stilton.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

breweries.name: Bube's Brewery
breweries.description: Bube's Brewery is located within the original brewery's icehouse. The mash/lauter tun and kettle have a 3.5 bbl capacity (approximately 110 gallons.) The brewers usually brew two consecutive batches to meet the capacity of the 10 bbl fermenters. In the brewery there are two 10 bbl fermenters and one 10 bbl conditioning tank for lagered beer.

breweries.name: Front Street Brewery
breweries.description:
Front Street Brewery, nestled beautifully along the bank of the Mighty Mississippi, has served the fine community of Davenport, Iowa for over 17 years. Front Street Brewery prides itself on embracing the local brewing history by providing some of the finest hand-crafted beers and ales in the area. This along with a relaxing dining atmosphere surley makes Front Street Brewery a must stop.


Front Street Brewery, a locally owned and operated business, is committed to continuing this legacy of providing great service and a friendly environment. After all, “We Are the Beer that Makes People Hoppy!”

breweries.name: Frog Level Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Our brewery is named for its location and its attitude. Until the railroad came in 1884, Frog level was swampland.  By the 30’s and 40’s Frog Level was the hustle & bustle in Waynesville. This was the place where blue collar folks worked hard in factories and warehouses to raise families…to do their part to make Haywood County what it is today.

Ours beers are distinct in their attitude and ingredients, by brewing as much “Haywood County” as possible into each batch!
